result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:41 AM Defendant DAVID MICHAEL ARABIA in court.  Attorney Ty Gasparek in court for DAVID MICHAEL ARABIA.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin. ASL interpreter sworn in.  Defense requests adjourned plea/sentencing hearing.  Victim's rights complied with.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

DC/DV/DC: CONDITIONS: No contact with V1, V2 or reporting party in Menasha report 22-1834. No contact with the 300 Block of Cleveland St in Menasha. Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are. May pick up belongings one time accompanied by police escort once 72 hour no contact is no longer in effect, provided there are no other court orders prohibiting contact. Comply with any CPS or DHS safety plan. Absolute sobriety. No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.
***8/10/22 No contact with V1 and V2 changed to NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH V 1 AND V2.  All other conditions remain the same.***

2:27 PM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Jeanne Struve in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant DAVID MICHAEL ARABIA appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Ty Gasparek in court for DAVID MICHAEL ARABIA. Interpreter sworn in for victim.  State moves to modify bond to no violent contact with V1 and V2.  Defendant does not object and requests contact with home address.  State objects to contact with residence.Information on file.  Defense acknowledges receipt of information and waives reading.  Noting a special appearance and enters a not guilty plea.  Court notes victim's rights are complied with.  Court orders amending bond.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond Condition
